definition: dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
Don't ask and you won't be told any lies. (idiom)
pinyin: bu4 wen4 jiu4 ting1 bu4 dao4 jia3 hua4

sentences.english: If I say a lie, my day is thundery break off, must not very dead.
sentences.chinese: 我要是說一句假話，我天打雷劈，不得好死。

sentences.english: Joseph is an honest person, he just doesn’t know how to say things that are not true.
sentences.chinese: 約瑟夫是個老實人，他就是不知道怎麼說假話。

sentences.english: Forget what you’ve read about communication being the key to a lasting relationship.
sentences.chinese: 什麼溝通交流是維繫一段感情的關鍵，都是假話。

sentences.english: Lucy had done that morning, but she palmed him off with some story or other.
sentences.chinese: 求道露西那幹些什，她套假話把瞞去。

sentences.english: Skilled at imitating human language, but usually lies.
sentences.chinese: 善模仿人語，但多說假話。

sentences.english: Mr. Lee who cried wolf many times has lost his credibility.
sentences.chinese: 多次說假話的李先生，已喪失人們對他的信任。

sentences.english: Now, is that a lie or a naive false statement?
sentences.chinese: 現在，這是謊言還是天真的假話？

sentences.english: He purposely speaks untruths, yet he gives seemingly factual details.
sentences.chinese: 他故意說假話，但他似乎讓事實細節。

sentences.english: There is nothing in it; the whole story is an absolute invention.
sentences.chinese: 全是假話，整個故事是憑空捏造出來的。

sentences.english: Lies sound true and truth actually are lies in fine- sounding words.
sentences.chinese: 在甜言蜜語裏，假話聽起來像真話實際上就是假話。

sentences.english: Lies sound true and truth actually are lies in fine- sounding words.
sentences.chinese: 在甜言蜜語裏，假話聽起來像真話實際上就是假話。

sentences.english: She palmed him off with some story or others.
sentences.chinese: 她用一套假話把他瞞過去了。

sentences.english: Overall, it seemed to take more brain effort to tell the lie than to tell the truth, Faro found.
sentences.chinese: 總體來說，人們說假話要比說實話付出更多的努力。

definition: to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
